prompt: Which marine mammal is known for having long, spiraled tusks?
icl_complete: The marine mammal known for having long, spiraled tusks is the narwhal. Narwhals are a species of whale found in Arctic waters, and their tusks can grow up to 10 feet long. These tusks are actually elongated canine teeth and are more commonly found on males, though some females also possess them. The exact purpose of the tusk is still a subject of study, but it is believed to play a role in mating rituals, social status, and possibly even in sensory perception.
